.@BetsyDeVosED will have to answer for her department‚Äôs inaction surrounding borrower defense in @EdLaborCmte. Ultimately, we want to find the best way forward to help our students & hold predatory schools accountable. I‚Äôm hopeful we‚Äôll make progress towards that goal this week.

.@SenatorDurbin and I introduced a Congressional Review Act to overturn @BetsyDevosED‚Äôs harmful Borrower Defense rule and force her and her Department to finally review and repay the claims of 200,000+ defrauded American students. https://susielee.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-susie-lee-sen-dick-durbin-lead-congressional-effort-overturn-damaging-devos¬†‚Ä¶

Most importantly, as the 2016 rule has been slow-walked by @BetsyDeVosED, over 220,000 borrower defense claims have been left pending, some for 3+ years. This includes 1000‚Äôs of veterans, working parents, and young students just trying to get an education and better themselves.

The moment @BetsyDeVosED took over, she delayed implementation of the 2016 rule--delays that were found illegal in court. 

She‚Äôs attempted to implement a weaker borrower defense rule that ultimately undermines the original purpose of borrower defense--to help defrauded students.

The 2016 Borrower Defense Rule, in part, included:

‚úÖClear processes for how to file claims
‚úÖEmpower @usedgov to forgive loans quickly
‚úÖHold financially irresponsible for-profit schools accountable
‚úÖBan schools from misleading students to signing unfair arbitration agreements

After Corinthian‚Äôs collapse, the Obama admin updated the 1995 Rule b/c it ‚Äúprovided little detail on how borrowers could submit, and how @usedgov would adjudicate claims.‚Äù 

In 2016, they issued the new defense rule--estimated to provide $17 billion of relief to students.

The rule rarely had to be used until the major collapse of the predatory for-profit college, Corinthian College. Corinthian‚Äôs collapse left an estimated 350,000 students with worthless degrees and a mountain of student debt, the loans of which they couldn‚Äôt use. (3/9)

The original Borrower Defense Rule was implemented as a provision in the 1995 High Education Act to establish how student loan borrowers can receive forgiveness when defrauded by their higher ed. Institution. (2/9)

This Thursday, @EdLaborCmte will question @BetsyDeVosED on @usedgov‚Äôs inaction in upholding the Borrower Defense Rule, created to protect students from predatory #4profit schools & help defrauded students seek loan forgiveness. Before then, let‚Äôs set the record straight. THREAD:

I‚Äôm so glad I was able to help Sandy Valley residents protect their right to reasonable food access. Solving problems like this is exactly why I came to Congress. 

Read more about our efforts here: https://susielee.house.gov/media/press-releases/problem-solved-rep-lee-helps-sandy-valley-general-store-secure-approval-snap¬†‚Ä¶

Shortly after, my office was notified that the store was reevaluated & approved as an official SNAP-retailer!

Bottom line: no reasonable person should expect a family on a limited budget to travel 38 miles roundtrip every time they need groceries. I‚Äôm glad @USDA recognized that.

Three weeks ago, I wrote to @SecretarySonny requesting that the store should be reevaluated because the area clearly has significantly limited access to food with a population that heavily relies on affordable food.

Without this store, residents who rely on SNAP need to travel NINETEEN miles to the next-closest SNAP-retailer to buy food. 

Two problems with that: 

1Ô∏è‚É£1 out of 3 Sandy Valley residents relies on SNAP.

2Ô∏è‚É£There is incredibly limited public transportation in Sandy Valley.

In August, the Sandy Valley General Store‚Äôs SNAP retailer application was denied, meaning residents could no longer use their SNAP benefits to shop there. @USDA's reason: the store wasn't in an area w/ ‚Äúsignificantly limited access to food.‚Äù @8NewsNow https://www.8newsnow.com/news/financial-struggles-cause-sandy-valley-general-store-owners-to-close-doors-owners-hope-to-regroup-reopen/¬†‚Ä¶

‚úÖPROBLEM SOLVED‚úÖ

After months of uncertainty, the Sandy Valley General Store was approved by @USDA as an authorized SNAP retailer.

This is a big deal & a lesson on the realities of limited food access in rural areas. How did we get to this point & why does it matter? THREAD:
